title: Freddie Flintoff hits the nail on the head with his impassioned rant about hugely inflated ticket prices
text:
Freddie Flintoff hits the nail on the head with his impassioned rant about hugely inflated ticket prices The former cricketer suggests football clubs are wasting the money they take from fans on travel Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now England cricket legend thinks fans deserve more respect Share this video Get Arsenal FC   
Freddie Flintoff launched an impassioned rant about outrageous ticket prices for football matches - and hit the nail on the head. 
The former England Test international, hit out at how much supporters are forced to fork out to watch their team play. 
And suggested Premier League clubs are wasting money in other areas. 
Speaking on BBC Radio 5 Live, Flintoff picked Arsenal as a prime example, given that the club's season ticket prices are very much at the high end of the scale. Freddie Flintoff hits out at inflated ticket prices (Photo: BBC) 
He said: "I am disputing looking after your loyal army of fans, the people who work day in day out, all week, saving up to watch on a Saturday afternoon. 
"And we know that footballers earn thousands, hundreds of thousands, there's money there for them, that's fine." 
Flintoff goes on to talk about fans no longer being able to identify with players, who are now global superstars in every sense of the word. The cricketer suggested players should not be travelling to games on planes (Photo: Arsenal FC via Getty Images) 
"The gulf is getting wider and wider and wider and I just look at Arsenal and the lowest match day ticket is £27, which doesn't sound too bad. 
"The highest is £97. You're telling me you're a fan, you've paid somewhere between that for a ticket, you're turning up, you're getting a train to the match. 
"You're spending £50 on travel, you're spending to park your car, and then you find out they're flying to Norwich on a private jet!" Flintoff picked Arsenal out for criticism (Photo: Arsenal FC via Getty Images) 
Suggesting the fans' money is going towards these extravagant travel arrangements, Flintoff adds: "Sort it out, how can you look at your fans in the eye? 
"How can you look at them when you're wasting god knows how much on travel?"
